verses.verse: And it came <S%G1096><s%> about that in Iconium <S%G2430><s%> they entered <S%G1525><s%> the synagogue <S%G4864><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> together <S%G2596><s%>, <S%G3588><s%> <S%G846><s%> and spoke <S%G2980><s%> in such <S%G3779><s%> a manner <S%G3779><s%> that a great <S%G4183><s%> multitude <S%G4128><s%> believed, <S%G4100><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> of Jews <S%G2453><s%> and of Greeks. <S%G1672><s%>

But the Jews <S%G2453><s%> who disbelieved <S%G544><s%> stirred <S%G1892><s%> up the minds <S%G5590><s%> of the Gentiles, <S%G1484><s%> and embittered <S%G2559><s%> them against <S%G2596><s%> the brethren. <S%G80><s%>

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> they spent <S%G1304><s%> a long <S%G2425><s%> time <S%G5550><s%> [there] speaking <S%G3955><s%> boldly <S%G3955><s%> [with reliance] upon the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> who was bearing <S%G3140><s%> witness <S%G3140><s%> to the word <S%G3056><s%> of His grace, <S%G5485><s%> granting <S%G1325><s%> that signs <S%G4592><s%> and wonders <S%G5059><s%> be done <S%G1096><s%> by their hands. <S%G5495><s%>

But the multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the city <S%G4172><s%> was divided; <S%G4977><s%> and some <S%G3588><s%> <S%G3303><s%> sided <S%G1510><s%> with the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> and some <S%G3588><s%> with the apostles. <S%G652><s%>

And when <S%G5613><s%> an attempt <S%G3730><s%> was made <S%G1096><s%> by both <S%G5037><s%> the Gentiles <S%G1484><s%> and the Jews <S%G2453><s%> with their rulers, <S%G758><s%> to mistreat <S%G5195><s%> and to stone <S%G3036><s%> them,

they became aware <S%G4894><s%> of it and fled <S%G2703><s%> to the cities <S%G4172><s%> of Lycaonia, <S%G3071><s%> Lystra <S%G3082><s%> and Derbe, <S%G1191><s%> and the surrounding <S%G4066><s%> region; <S%G4066><s%>
and there <S%G2546><s%> they continued to preach <S%G2097><s%> the gospel. <S%G2097><s%>

And at Lystra <S%G3082><s%> there was sitting <S%G2521><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> without <S%G102><s%> strength <S%G102><s%> in his feet, <S%G4228><s%> lame <S%G5560><s%> from his mother's womb, <S%G2836><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> had never <S%G3763><s%> walked. <S%G4043><s%>

This <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> was listening <S%G191><s%> to Paul <S%G3972><s%> as he spoke, <S%G2980><s%> who, <S%G3739><s%> when he had fixed <S%G816><s%> his gaze <S%G816><s%> upon him, and had seen <S%G3708><s%> that he had <S%G2192><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> to be made <S%G4982><s%> well, <S%G4982><s%>

said <S%G3004><s%> with a loud <S%G3173><s%> voice, <S%G5456><s%> "Stand <S%G450><s%> upright <S%G3717><s%> on your feet. <S%G4228><s%>" And he leaped <S%G242><s%> up and [began] to walk. <S%G4043><s%>

And when the multitudes <S%G3793><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> had done, <S%G4160><s%> they raised <S%G1869><s%> their voice, <S%G5456><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> in the Lycaonian <S%G3072><s%> language, <S%G3072><s%> "The gods <S%G2316><s%> have become <S%G3666><s%> like <S%G3666><s%> men <S%G444><s%> and have come <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> to us."

And they [began] calling <S%G2564><s%> Barnabas, <S%G921><s%> Zeus, <S%G2203><s%> and Paul, <S%G3972><s%> Hermes, <S%G2060><s%> because <S%G1894><s%> he was the chief <S%G2233><s%> speaker. <S%G3056><s%>

And the priest <S%G2409><s%> of Zeus, <S%G2203><s%> whose [temple] was just <S%G4253><s%> outside <S%G4253><s%> the city, <S%G4172><s%> brought <S%G5342><s%> oxen <S%G5022><s%> and garlands <S%G4725><s%> to the gates, <S%G4440><s%> and wanted <S%G2309><s%> to offer <S%G2380><s%> sacrifice <S%G2380><s%> with the crowds. <S%G3793><s%>

But when the apostles, <S%G652><s%> Barnabas <S%G921><s%> and Paul, <S%G3972><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of it, they tore <S%G1284><s%> their robes <S%G2440><s%> and rushed <S%G7061><s%> out into the crowd, <S%G3793><s%> crying <S%G2896><s%> out

and saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Men, <S%G435><s%> why <S%G5101><s%> are you doing <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%>? We are also <S%G2532><s%> men <S%G444><s%> of the same <S%G3663><s%> nature <S%G3663><s%> as you, and preach <S%G2097><s%> the gospel <S%G2097><s%> to you in order that you should turn <S%G1994><s%> from these <S%G3778><s%> vain <S%G3152><s%> things <S%G3152><s%> to a living <S%G2198><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> made <S%G4160><s%> the heaven <S%G3772><s%> and the earth <S%G1093><s%> and the sea, <S%G2281><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> that is in them.
"And in the generations <S%G1074><s%> gone <S%G3944><s%> by He permitted <S%G1439><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the nations <S%G1484><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> their own ways; <S%G3598><s%>

and yet <S%G2543><s%> He did not leave <S%G863><s%> Himself <S%G848><s%> without <S%G267><s%> witness, <S%G267><s%> in that He did <S%G7500><s%> good <S%G7500><s%> and gave <S%G1325><s%> you rains <S%G5205><s%> from heaven <S%G3771><s%> and fruitful <S%G2593><s%> seasons, <S%G2540><s%> satisfying <S%G1705><s%> your hearts <S%G2588><s%> with food <S%G5160><s%> and gladness. <S%G2167><s%> "

And [even] saying <S%G3004><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> they with difficulty <S%G3433><s%> restrained <S%G2664><s%> the crowds <S%G3793><s%> from offering <S%G2380><s%> sacrifice <S%G2380><s%> to them.

But Jews <S%G2453><s%> came <S%G1904><s%> from Antioch <S%G490><s%> and Iconium, <S%G2430><s%> and having won <S%G3982><s%> over <S%G3982><s%> the multitudes, <S%G3793><s%> they stoned <S%G3034><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and dragged <S%G4951><s%> him out of the city, <S%G4172><s%> supposing <S%G3543><s%> him to be dead. <S%G2348><s%>

But while the disciples <S%G3101><s%> stood <S%G2944><s%> around <S%G2944><s%> him, he arose <S%G450><s%> and entered <S%G1525><s%> the city. <S%G4172><s%> And the next <S%G1887><s%> day <S%G1887><s%> he went <S%G1831><s%> away <S%G1831><s%> with Barnabas <S%G921><s%> to Derbe. <S%G1191><s%>

And after they had preached <S%G2097><s%> the gospel <S%G2097><s%> to that city <S%G4172><s%> and had made <S%G3100><s%> many <S%G2425><s%> disciples, <S%G3100><s%> they returned <S%G5290><s%> to Lystra <S%G3082><s%> and to Iconium <S%G2430><s%> and to Antioch, <S%G490><s%>

strengthening <S%G1991><s%> the souls <S%G5590><s%> of the disciples, <S%G3101><s%> encouraging <S%G3870><s%> them to continue <S%G1696><s%> in the faith, <S%G4102><s%> and [saying,] "Through <S%G1223><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> tribulations <S%G2347><s%> we must <S%G1163><s%> enter <S%G1525><s%> the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>"

And when they had appointed <S%G5500><s%> elders <S%G4245><s%> for them in every <S%G2596><s%> church, <S%G1577><s%> having prayed <S%G4336><s%> with fasting, <S%G3521><s%> they commended <S%G3908><s%> them to the Lord <S%G2962><s%> in whom <S%G3739><s%> they had believed. <S%G4100><s%>
And they passed <S%G1330><s%> through <S%G1330><s%> Pisidia <S%G4099><s%> and came <S%G2064><s%> into Pamphylia. <S%G3828><s%>
And when they had spoken <S%G2980><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> in Perga, <S%G4011><s%> they went <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> to Attalia; <S%G825><s%>

and from there <S%G2547><s%> they sailed <S%G636><s%> to Antioch, <S%G490><s%> from which <S%G3606><s%> they had been <S%G1510><s%> commended <S%G3860><s%> to the grace <S%G5485><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> for the work <S%G2041><s%> that they had accomplished. <S%G4137><s%>

And when they had arrived <S%G3854><s%> and gathered <S%G4863><s%> the church <S%G1577><s%> together, <S%G4863><s%> they [began] to report <S%G312><s%> all <S%G3745><s%> things <S%G3745><s%> that God <S%G2316><s%> had done <S%G4160><s%> with them and how <S%G3754><s%> He had opened <S%G455><s%> a door <S%G2374><s%> of faith <S%G4102><s%> to the Gentiles. <S%G1484><s%>
And they spent <S%G1304><s%> a long <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3641><s%> time <S%G5550><s%> with the disciples. <S%G3101><s%>
